nodes.text: Internet of Things (IoT) technologies can enable effective home automation that makes daily life faster, more comfortable, and remotely manageable
This paper is a literature review summarizing IoT concepts, architecture, benefits, technologies, protocols, applications, and prior home automation implementations
IoT is defined as connecting appliances to sensors and the Internet to enable automatic, remote control and device-to-device communication
IoT-enabled home automation allows remote control of domestic appliances and can reduce or eliminate need for direct user intervention
Benefits of IoT home automation include better device monitoring through device-to-device transmission
IoT home automation increases efficiency and saves time by automating repetitive tasks and producing more consistent results
IoT home systems can save money through more optimal energy and resource use when devices are monitored and controlled
Additional IoT home benefits include improved quality of life, creation of smart environments (e.g., automated window and shade control), and health monitoring for patients and vulnerable people
Surveyed applications of IoT extend beyond home automation to smart cities, industrial automation, health monitoring, and environmental monitoring

Major IoT communication technologies and protocols relevant to home automation include Bluetooth/BLE, ZigBee, Z-Wave, WiFi, Cellular, NFC, and LoRaWAN, each with tradeoffs in range, power, data rate, and cost

Prior literature reports: a WiFi-based home automation prototype that is scalable and flexible; low-cost expandable IoT systems that control appliances remotely; architecture discussions on sensing-based monitoring; and reviews highlighting security and privacy challenges
Evidence from Ahmed ElShafee (2012) and Vinay Sagar (2015): WiFi-based and low-cost IoT prototypes achieved remote appliance control and demonstrated scalability and satisfactory operation

Evidence from reviews (Anurag Tiwari et al., Satish Palaniappan, others): IoT systems commonly integrate sensors for automation but face recurring security and privacy issues that limit trustworthiness
Limitation: IoT adoption may disadvantage users without IT expertise and raises exploitation and accessibility concerns
Conclusion: IoT has broad scope across sectors and can make life faster and more comfortable; combining AI with IoT can further improve home automation capabilities
